results.title: Blood: composition and functions
results.brief_description: Microphotography shows three cellular components of the blood and their functions. Time-lapse photography clearly indicates coagulation and fibrin formation; and the manufacture of cells in bone marrow from primitive cells is examined. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Blood transfusion
results.creator_credit: H.M. Nieter, Paul Rotha and Paul Rotha Productions
results.brief_description: Tells the story of how doctors and scientists of many nations made possible modern methods of preserving blood and using it far from the places where the blood was given. It traces the development and present operation of the blood donor system in Britain, emphasises the work to be done in peace as well as war, and appeals to everyone to give blood to save the lives of others.

results.title: Blood on the wattle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hypothetical (Television Program)”.
Focuses on the importance and relevance of the Australian Constitution to its citizens. Apart from looking at its origins, and other constitutional models, this kit explores the implications of making changes to the Australian Constitution. Based on one of “Geoffrey Robertson’s Hypotheticals” entitled “Blood on the wattle”. Also includes a post-hypothetical discussion of the Constitution by the panellists.

results.title: Blood money
results.creator_credit: Chris Fitchett, Chris Oliver and Tom Broadbridge
results.brief_description: Tense thriller starring Bryan Brown and John Flaus. Pete, a professional criminal who is dying of cancer, returns to Melbourne to settle a few scores. He wants to meet up with his ex-girlfriend and effect a reconciliation before facing death. The crime story is presented entirely from the criminal’s perspective. Rated: M

results.title: Blood and circulation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanics of Life”.
Uses x-ray photography and animation to describe how the human blood system is designed. Shows the composition of blood through microphotography, and discusses the role of each blood component.

results.title: Blood-borne pathogens in the workplace
results.brief_description: Blood-borne pathogens are microorganisms which can cause disease. They can be found in infected blood and bodily fluids. Diseases which can be spread by blood-borne pathogens include malaria and syphilis, but today, the most common are Hepatitis B and AIDS. This program gives clear, practical information on what blood-borne pathogens are, how they can (and can’t) be transmitted, what you can do to reduce the risk of transmission in the workplace, and how to minimise risk if you are exposed to a blood-borne pathogen due to an accident. Made with the support of the Infection Control Department, Fairfield Hospital.

constellations_other.name: Newsreel to nightly news
constellations_other.description: For decades, newsreel companies covered the news, providing weekly stories of current events, sport, and entertainment to audiences at the cinema, and establishing the format that would be taken up by television and the nightly news.

results.title: Blinker's spy-spotter
results.creator_credit: Jack Stephens, Harold Orton, Children's Film Foundation and Eyeline Films
results.brief_description: The story of young “Blinker” (a professor’s son) who loves gadgets of all kinds. Blinker and his frinds thwart an attempt by a rival gang of boys to steal a top secret invention of the professor’s.

results.title: Blind man's bluff
results.creator_credit: Gerry O'Hara, Cyril Randell, Children's Film Foundation and Willis World Wide Films
results.brief_description: A young boy named Joe Hunter is kidnapped after his father wins 200,000 pounds in the lottery. His two young friends team up with Smithie, a blind man, and together they discover who kidnapped Joe, resulting in his rescue.

results.title: Bligh of the Bounty: world navigator
results.creator_credit: Dennis Murphy, Bruce Harris and Rolf Harris Video Productions
results.brief_description: A four-part television documentary presented by Rolf Harris, with accompanying book, about the life and journeys of Captain William Bligh. Captain of the ill-fated Bounty, Bligh was also a navigator, surveyor and explorer. The series covers the story of Captain Bligh from his birth to his death, and follows his voyages from England through the Canary Islands, the Caribbean and Canada to the South Pacific. The 112 page book ‘Mutiny on the Bounty’ presents an in-depth historical survey of the Mutiny, its causes and its consequences through essays, articles and colour illustrations.
